title: Spherical olives and snail porridge: a new book asks, what makes a 'signature dish' (and are they any good)?
text:
“The discovery of a new dish does more for the happiness of mankind than the discovery of a star,” declared legendary French epicure Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin in 1825. His famous line – hyperbolic certainly, Eurocentric probably – is the guiding principle behind Signature Dishes That Matter, a "history of gastronomy in 240 dishes’" released on October 12 by Phaidon.

A handsome, heavyweight volume with marbled endpapers and gilt lettering, Signature Dishes That Matter falls somewhere between a cookbook and an encyclopaedia.
